summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both identified as components of the BTEX group, which includes benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, and xylene. These volatile organic compounds (VOCs) are derived from petroleum and are noted for their toxic properties and environmental mobility. The discussion highlights their significance as environmental contaminants, particularly in relation to water pollution and human health risks, but does not delve into their specific interactions or comparative toxicity.
